thread.title: Photographer captures babies nestling in the 'bump bowl'
thread.title_full: Photographer captures babies nestling in the 'bump bowl'

title: Photographer captures babies nestling in the 'bump bowl'
text: Share this article Share 'Clients have hung casts on the wall in their nursery, painted it with hand and foot prints and even used it as a fruit bowl,' she said. A sleepy baby looks perfectly snug and content snoozing in his plaster cocoon Mothers-to-be can choose between a mould of their entire torso or just the bump itself A woolly hat with ears on this sleepy newborn only adds to the endearing effect It takes between an hour and 90 minutes to take a cast of a mum-to-be's baby bump It's no wonder the baby's look snug - their 'bed' is the exact same shape as the bump that sheltered them before they were born A woman, above, relaxes as somebody covers her stomach in bandages for the casting Snug as a bug in a rug - or a newborn baby in a mould of its mother's pregnant stomach The skin is coated in Vaseline before bandages are applied to create the plaster cast This little one peeks curiously at the camera during their sweet photo shoot This baby was wrapped in a yellow blanket for the shot, and flowers added to the effect Another adorable newborn snuggles up inside a plaster cast mould The studio says the unique shoots are becoming increasingly popular with mothers-to-be Slinky's former clients have gone on to use the mould for everything from a wall decoration to a fruit bowl Read more: Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
